meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she rosed early to catch the sunrise.
meanings.sent2: She rosed from her chair and walked to the window.
meanings.sent3: The cat rosed lazily from its nap in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The hot air balloon rosed gracefully into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The bread dough rosed slowly in the warm kitchen.

meanings.definition: having the color of a rose
meanings.sent1: The beautiful dress had a rosy hue that matched her cheeks.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky in a rosy glow.
meanings.sent3: The rosy cheeks of the baby made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The morning sky was a rosy canvas of colors.
meanings.sent5: The rosy petals of the flower brightened the garden.

meanings.sent1: The rosy garden was rosed with blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: The wedding cake was rosed with delicate sugar roses.
meanings.sent3: The princess wore a gown rosed with intricate rose patterns.
meanings.sent4: The room was rosed with the sweet scent of roses.
meanings.sent5: The table was rosed with a beautiful bouquet of roses.
